comment: I loved Professor Johnson's class! She became my freshman seminar professor in the middle of the semester after my original professor left and it was a very smooth transition. She gave us many group projects and they helped us learn more about the campus. Overall, I think she is a great professor who is very understanding and is willing to help.

Professor J is amazing! The class is  mandatory, but she  makes it enjoyable and leaves a lasting impression on her students. You really get something out of it in the end, and she's someone you can always count on, even after the class. 1 major essay, 1 group community issue project, and 1 individual community (10 service hours required) project

If you like group projects, community work, and talking about your feelings then this is the class for you. Really easy. A few essays but she grades so easily that anyone can pass. Tons and tons of assignments but they're all easy. Teacher doesn't really get that some students have a life outside of studying.

She gives out small assignments periodically throughout the semester, but they're all fairly easy. There is an individual community service project that requires 10 hours of community service that needs to be done throughout the semester. There's also a big community project that you do in a group that begins in the middle of the semester.

Prof. Johnson takes this class very seriously and makes it fairly difficult considering it is a required course. Only 2 test but must complete 10 hours of community service and a huge group project. There are a few presentations also. I like her as a person, but her grading is sometimes unclear. Not sure if I would take again.

I hated the class content and the group project was a nightmare, but Mrs. Johnson was a great teacher. Even if your team does bad on the group project, she notices who works for it and who's slacking off. I got an A in the class despite my dislike of the reading materiel, and she likes discussion.

Well, its all about an individual project and a group project. Pick a good group or your screwed. Sometimes she is confusing and be there in class because she gives good tips for midterm and final. Very sweet and layback. But do the work!

Mrs. Johnson knows that no one wants to take this mandatory class so she is very relaxed and works with the students. The material, other than the personality tests, isn't interesting, but she is a fun person. If she taught another class other than KSU Seminar, I'd totally be in it.

She is okay, but I did not particularly like going to the class. It is very boring and all we do is go over powerpoints. It kind of seems like a waste of time. She makes mistakes a lot and tries to make it sound like that crap actually applies to our life. Just actually study for the quizzes and tests and you'll be fine.

Well, the class is alright, very boring. It reminds me of a high school class. Students usually talk half the class about pointless things. Easy A, just do the work assigned. A midterm and final. If you study the quizzes for the test, you will do fine. She's there to help, just make sure to ask her in person because she is bad in answering emails.
